A couple fascinated by the mysterious world of the paranormal take their curiosity across the country.

episodes.name: A Haunting at The Octagon Mansion

info.plot: There is a building In Wytheville, Virginia that has never been filmed for it’s paranormal activity. The Octagon Mansion is reportedly haunted by the ghost of a little girl who died during a 1950’s polio epidemic. Have you ever seen a poltergeist throw something? This is the scariest place in the state of Virginia and it has all been captured on camera. It helped James Huston through his battle with cancer.<

An upstate South Carolina family seek the help of two paranormal investigators to capture evidence of the strange phenomena taking place inside their historical home. To respect the privacy of the homeowners this location will be remain undisclosed.

Connor and India travel to Radford, Virginia to do a paranormal investigation at the notoriously haunted St Albans Sanatorium. What starts out as a normal paranormal investigation quickly takes an intense turn and the duo begin to discover that the ghosts may be more than just stories.

In 2019 Paranormal Encounters filmed at a home in upstate South Carolina where a family was experiencing paranormal activity. They captured evidence on a camera which was left overnight that they could never find an explanation for. Connor and India return to further investigate the strange happenings of this highly active home. This time they dive deeper into the story of the home as they attempt to match up any evidence they gather.

On this episode of Paranormal Encounters, Connor and India travel to Winchester, Indiana to investigate the historic Stone Mansion. What they expect to be a quiet night turns into one of the most compelling investigations in a long while as they converse with the other side. They quickly find that what they capture backs up the paranormal claims other visitors have experienced inside this haunted mansion.

Connor and India spend one of the scariest nights of their lives inside the Randolph County Infirmary in Winchester, Indiana. With paranormal activity starting from the moment they enter the building, the couple start to get the sense they are being followed by someone - or something. They soon discover just how haunted some buildings can be.&nbsp

On this episode of Paranormal Encounters, Connor and India travel to South Pittsburg, TN to investigate the Old South Pittsburg Hospital Paranormal Research Center. Joined by a special guest, the trio discover that the ghost stories about this haunted hospital hold a lot more truth than most would like to believe.

Connor and India travel to Mitchell, Indiana to investigate the notoriously haunted Whispers Estate. From EVPs to doors opening by themselves to demonic apparitions, this seemingly quaint home has had it\'s fair share of reports of paranormal activity. From the moment the duo walk through the door they discover that the walls inside this haunted house really do whisper.

Forget fake scares—this is real. Join Sean Kenna, Sean Owen, and Karl Hassall as they explore Britain’s darkest, most haunted places. Dark Territory pushes the limits of ghost hunting, with paranormal encounters that are anything but made-up. Ready to believe?

The Dark Territory crew returns to the place that started it all—The Leopard Hotel. With its Victorian past and personal paranormal history, the team hopes the spirits remember them. An eerie reunion with the unknown.

A museum of haunted objects, built inside a former cinema, has ghost hunters running scared. The Dark Territory team dives in to face the cursed items and unexplained energy head-on. Get ready for one of their most intense investigations yet.

A secret Cold War bunker turned museum, Hack Green has become a hotspot for eerie encounters. The Dark Territory team explores why this wartime relic—built for a war that never came—now whispers with voices from the past. Ready to go underground?

With Coronavirus restrictions beginning to lift in England, the boys get back to what they do best... getting hopelessly lost in a deep forest, reknown for supernatural sightings! From the infamous black-eyed children, to warewolves, UFO’s and aliens, for some unknown reason Cannock Chase is said to be a hub for paranormal activity!

The Dark Territory team heads deep into a 17th-century silver mine to investigate centuries of mystery. Visitors and staff have reported eerie events—now it’s time to find out what really lurks in the tunnels of Silver Mountain. Underground just got unsettling.

Deep in a 19th-century fort, the Dark Territory team faces something they may never forget. As fear takes over, they begin to question what they’ve disturbed—and how far they’re willing to go to face it. Some tunnels should stay sealed…

At Mill Street Barracks—once a morgue, now a hotspot for hauntings—the team tests a Ouija board to connect with whatever still lingers. Dark Territory: Mill Street Barracks is a deep dive into one of England’s eeriest locations. Hope you’re not watching alone.

The Dark Territory team confronts one of the UK’s darkest legends—the Ancient Ram Inn. Known as England’s most haunted building, it’s a place that even seasoned ghost hunters fear. What they find inside is anything but welcoming.

Blast off with The New Frontier, a space documentary series that follows satellites and probes across the solar system. Each episode explores new discoveries, bold missions, and the ever-expanding edge of space exploration.

episodes.name: The New Frontier  -  From There to Here - Season 1 - Eps 1

info.plot: The New Frontier  -  From There to Here - Season 1 - Eps 1 - We’re kicking things off by looking at how we got from dreaming about space to actually getting there. From early rockets to satellites snapping pics of Earth, we’ll show you how space travel went from wild to awesome. Buckle up.

episodes.name: The New Frontier  - Return to The Moon - Season 1 - Eps 2

info.plot: The New Frontier  - Return to The Moon - Season 1 - Eps 2 -Robotic missions are making the Moon busy again! We’ll check out the latest lunar landers & orbiters, the science they’re sending home, & how new plans for moon bases could mean humans are heading back. The next giant leap? It’s coming.

episodes.name: The New Frontier  - The Inner Worlds - Season 1 - Eps 3

info.plot: The New Frontier  - The Inner Worlds - Season 1 - Eps 3 - Mercury and Venus are tough nuts to crack-one’s roasting close to the Sun, the other’s got clouds that’ll melt your lander. But that’s what makes them so awesome. We’ll dig into why these inner planets are so different from Earth.

episodes.name: The New Frontier  -  Next Stop Mars - Season 1 - Eps 4

info.plot: The New Frontier  -  Next Stop Mars - Season 1 - Eps 4 - Mars is calling, and we’re totally ready to answer. From wild rover missions to the tech that’ll get us there, we’ll break down what it takes to reach the Red Planet-and why everyone’s racing to be first. Mars, here we come.

episodes.name: The New Frontier  - The Planet Makers - Season 1 - Eps 5

info.plot: The New Frontier  - The Planet Makers - Season 1 - Eps 5 -How are planets built? We’re talking cosmic collisions, wild chemistry, & the mega forces that turn dust & gas to whole new worlds. From baby planets to  giants, we’ll break down the science that makes our solar system a pretty wild place.

episodes.name: The New Frontier  -  The Ice Giants - Season 1 - Eps 6

info.plot: The New Frontier  -  The Ice Giants - Season 1 - Eps 6 - Uranus and Neptune are the solar system’s mega mystery machines-icy, windy, & totally wild. We’ll dig into what makes these distant giants tick, from blue storms to rings, moons you’ve never heard of. Space is cold, but these planets are cool.

episodes.name: The New Frontier  - The Moons of Olympus - Season 1 - Eps 7

info.plot: The New Frontier  - The Moons of Olympus - Season 1 - Eps 7 - Some of the solar system’s wildest moons hang out near Jupiter and Saturn-think icy volcanoes, hidden oceans, and mega mysteries. We’ll explore these epic moons and the science that’s rewriting what we know about our cosmic neighborhood.

episodes.name: The New Frontier  -  The Sun - Season 1 - Eps 8

info.plot: The New Frontier  -  The Sun - Season 1 - Eps 8 - Ready to get up close with our local star? We’ll dive into the wild storms, mega flares, and the science that keeps the Sun burning bright. From solar power to space weather, it’s the hottest show in the solar system.

episodes.name: The New Frontier  - Exo Planets - Season 1 - Eps 9

info.plot: The New Frontier  - Exo Planets - Season 1 - Eps 9 - Planets beyond our solar system? Yep, they’re out there-by the thousands! We’ll break down how astronomers spot these wild worlds, what makes them so tricky to find, and why exoplanets might just be the best shot at finding alien life.

episodes.name: The New Frontier  -  Edge of the Universe - Season 1 - Eps 10

info.plot: The New Frontier  -  Edge of the Universe - Season 1 - Eps 10 - We’re heading to the edge-literally. Join us as we chase the wildest mysteries at the farthest reaches of space, from mind-bending galaxies to the secrets of cosmic expansion. The universe is huge, weird, and totally awesome.

episodes.name: The New Frontier  - The Dark Side - Season 2 - Eps 10

info.plot: The New Frontier  - The Dark Side - Season 2 - Eps 10 - Ever wonder what’s hiding on the Moon’s far side? We’ll shine a light on the mysteries lurking in the lunar shadows, from hidden craters to wild science surprises. Space is weird-and we’re here for it.

episodes.name: The New Frontier  -  Stars Above - Season 2 - Eps 9

info.plot: The New Frontier  -  Stars Above - Season 2 - Eps 9 - Ever look up and wonder what’s really out there? We’ll take you on a ride across the night sky, from familiar constellations to the wild mysteries hiding way beyond. Grab your telescope-space is about to get mega interesting!

episodes.name: The New Frontier  -  First Light - Season 2 - Eps 8

info.plot: The New Frontier  -  First Light - Season 2 - Eps 8 - Catch the universe’s first sparks! We’ll dive into how the earliest stars and galaxies lit up the cosmos, turning darkness into a mega light show. It’s the ultimate origin story-and trust us, it’s totally stellar.

episodes.name: The New Frontier  - Danger Asteroids Ahead - Season 2 - Eps 7

info.plot: The New Frontier  - Danger Asteroids Ahead - Season 2 - Eps 7 - Ever worry about giant space rocks with our name on them? We get it. In this episode, we track asteroids flying close to Earth, meet the tech keeping watch, and see how scientists plan to dodge disaster. Space is a wild place.

episodes.name: The New Frontier  - Emissaries - Season 2 - Eps 6

info.plot: The New Frontier  - Emissaries - Season 2 - Eps 6 - Robots and probes are out there doing the heavy lifting for us, sending back epic data from across the solar system. We’ll show you how these mechanical emissaries explore where humans can’t, making space a less lonely and a lot more awesome.

episodes.name: The New Frontier  - Mars: Adapt or Leave - Season 2 - Eps 5

info.plot: The New Frontier  - Mars: Adapt or Leave - Season 2 - Eps 5 - Mars isn’t messing around. If we want to stick around, we’ll have to get creative-think wild habitats, new tech, and some mega problem-solving. Can we handle Mars, or will the Red Planet send us packing? Time to find out.

episodes.name: The New Frontier  - Shore to Shore - Season 2 - Eps 4

info.plot: The New Frontier  - Shore to Shore - Season 2 - Eps 4 - We’re charting new courses across alien oceans and mysterious coastlines. From wild tides on distant moons to the secrets hidden beneath icy surfaces, we’ll show you how shorelines shape worlds-ours and way, way beyond.

episodes.name: The New Frontier  - Orbit - Season 2 - Eps 3

info.plot: The New Frontier  - Orbit - Season 2 - Eps 3 - You know what keeps satellites, space stations, and even the Moon circling around? It’s all about orbit! We’ll break down how stuff stays up there, why orbits matter, and what happens when things go off track. Space is wild-let’s get in the loop!

episodes.name: The New Frontier  -  Getting There - Season 2 - Eps 2

info.plot: The New Frontier  -  Getting There - Season 2 - Eps 2 - Getting to space isn’t a walk in the park. We’ll show you the wild rides, clever engineering, and mega teamwork it takes to launch, dock, and survive the trip. Buckle up-because getting there is half the adventure!

episodes.name: The New Frontier  -  The Astronauts - Season 2 - Eps 1

info.plot: The New Frontier  -  The Astronauts - Season 2 - Eps 1 - Who signs up to rocket off this planet? Astronauts do-and they’re a special breed. We’ll dive into the wild training, mega teamwork, and guts it takes to launch into the unknown. Space isn’t easy, but these folks make it look awesome.

episodes.name: The New Frontier  - Interface - Season 3 - Eps 10

info.plot: The New Frontier  - Interface - Season 3 - Eps 10 - Explore the ionosphere—the dynamic interface between Earth and space. Discover how this layer of charged particles impacts radio, radar, satellites, and GPS, and why satellites are crucial for unlocking its mysteries.

episodes.name: The New Frontier  - Gravity - Season 3 - Eps 9

info.plot: The New Frontier  - Gravity - Season 3 - Eps 9 - Explore gravity, the universal force that keeps planets in orbit and our feet on the ground. Discover how space missions reveal gravity’s mysteries, from microgravity in orbit to the secrets this force is slowly giving up about our universe

episodes.name: The New Frontier  - Cosmic collisions - Season 3 - Eps 8

info.plot: The New Frontier  - Cosmic collisions - Season 3 - Eps 8 - Space is a violent place where dust and rocks collide to form asteroids, planets, and stars. Explore massive cosmic collisions—from asteroids to galaxies—that shape the universe with bursts of light and energy over millions of years.

episodes.name: The New Frontier  -  Living Planet - Season 3 - Eps 7

info.plot: The New Frontier  -  Living Planet - Season 3 - Eps 7 - After 40 years of Earth observation, new technologies and massive data reveal our planet as a complex, ever-changing living system. Explore how satellites and science uncover the dynamic forces shaping our world

episodes.name: The New Frontier  - Slingshot - Season 3 - Eps 6

info.plot: The New Frontier  - Slingshot - Season 3 - Eps 6 - Discover how spacecraft use planetary slingshot maneuvers—gravity assists—to gain speed and change course, enabling ambitious missions to the outer solar system and beyond in this episode of The New Frontier.

episodes.name: The New Frontier  -  Juno, Cassini and Beyond - Season 3 - Eps 5

info.plot: The New Frontier  -  Juno, Cassini and Beyond - Season 3 - Eps 5 - The Cassini and Huygens missions unveil Saturn’s secrets, while Juno dives deep into Jupiter’s mysteries. Explore how these groundbreaking spacecraft, along with New Horizons, expand our understanding of the outer solar system.

episodes.name: The New Frontier  -  Invasion Mars - Season 3 - Eps 4

info.plot: The New Frontier  -  Invasion Mars - Season 3 - Eps 4 - For over 50 years, probes and landers have paved the way for Mars exploration. Now, new missions and technologies are preparing for humanity’s first steps on the Red Planet, aiming to unlock its secrets and establish a human presence on Mars.

episodes.name: The New Frontier  -  Flight Status - Season 3 - Eps 3

info.plot: The New Frontier  -  Flight Status - Season 3 - Eps 3 -

episodes.name: The New Frontier  - Atmosphere - Season 3 - Eps 2

info.plot: The New Frontier  - Atmosphere - Season 3 - Eps 2 - Explore Earth’s atmosphere-our planet’s complex, protective envelope of gases. Discover how it shields us from space, sustains life, and why understanding its dynamics is crucial for our future in this episode of The New Frontier.

episodes.name: The New Frontier  - Living in Space - Season 3 - Eps 1

info.plot: The New Frontier  - Living in Space - Season 3 - Eps 1 - Ever wonder what it’s like to call space home? We’ll show you how astronauts eat, sleep, and stay sane while floating above Earth. It’s weird, it’s wild, and honestly, it’s mega cool. Welcome to life in orbit with gravity - no problem!

episodes.name: The New Frontier  -  Where Are All the Aliens? - Season 4 - Eps 10

info.plot: The New Frontier  -  Where Are All the Aliens? - Season 4 - Eps 10 - Scientists search the cosmos for extraterrestrial life but come up empty-handed. This episode explores why, examining the Fermi Paradox, the challenges of detection, and what our ongoing search reveals about life in the universe.

episodes.name: The New Frontier  -  Proving Einstein - Season 4 - Eps 9

info.plot: The New Frontier  -  Proving Einstein - Season 4 - Eps 9 - Scientists put Einstein’s theories to the test, using cutting-edge experiments and cosmic observations to confirm the reality of phenomena like gravitational waves and quantum entanglement, reshaping our understanding of the universe.

episodes.name: The New Frontier  - Cubesats - Season 4 - Eps 8

info.plot: The New Frontier  - Cubesats - Season 4 - Eps 8 - Cubesats, tiny modular satellites, have revolutionized space science. Once limited to low Earth orbit, they now enable ambitious missions across the solar system, driving innovation, rapid deployment, and new discoveries in space exploration.

episodes.name: The New Frontier  - Martian Attractions - Season 4 - Eps 7

info.plot: The New Frontier  - Martian Attractions - Season 4 - Eps 7 - Explore the latest breakthroughs in Martian exploration, from orbiters to ground rovers. Discover new sources of water and witness the dramatic dust storms shaping the ever-evolving story of the Red Planet.

episodes.name: The New Frontier  -  Eyes to The Heavens - Season 4 - Eps 6

info.plot: The New Frontier  -  Eyes to The Heavens - Season 4 - Eps 6 - Gaia and TESS, two powerful space telescopes, complete their missions to map stars and search for exoplanets, advancing our knowledge of the cosmos and paving the way for future astronomical discoveries.

episodes.name: The New Frontier  - Hyabusa 2 - Season 4 - Eps 5

info.plot: The New Frontier  - Hyabusa 2 - Season 4 - Eps 5 - Japan’s Hayabusa2 mission reaches asteroid Ryugu, collecting samples to unlock secrets of the solar system’s origins and planetary defense. The return of these samples to Earth marks a breakthrough in space exploration.

episodes.name: The New Frontier  - Mercury or Bust - Season 4 - Eps 4

info.plot: The New Frontier  - Mercury or Bust - Season 4 - Eps 4 - Explore the challenges and triumphs of sending spacecraft to Mercury. Discover how missions like MESSENGER reveal the planet’s extreme environment, unique geology, and what Mercury teaches us about the origins of our solar system.

episodes.name: The New Frontier  - Tickets Please - Season 4 - Eps 3

info.plot: The New Frontier  - Tickets Please - Season 4 - Eps 3 - Explore how satellites and space technology revolutionize global transportation. From tracking flights to managing railways and shipping, discover how these innovations keep our world moving safely and efficiently.

episodes.name: The New Frontier  - Set Course for The Heart of The Sun - Season 4 - Eps 2

info.plot: The New Frontier  - Set Course for The Heart of The Sun - Season 4 - Eps 2 - Spacecraft embark on daring missions to study the Sun up close. Discover how new technology helps us unlock the secrets of solar storms, solar wind, and the forces that shape our solar system in this illuminating episode.

episodes.name: The New Frontier  - The Cryosphere - Season 4 - Eps 1

info.plot: The New Frontier  - The Cryosphere - Season 4 - Eps 1 - Explore how satellites and space missions monitor Earth’s cryosphere—its ice sheets, glaciers, and frozen regions—revealing the impacts of climate change, rising sea levels, and the urgent need for global action.

episodes.name: The New Frontier  - The Next Big Leaps - Season 5 - Eps 10

info.plot: The New Frontier  - The Next Big Leaps - Season 5 - Eps 10 - Visionary scientists and engineers reveal the next breakthroughs in space exploration, from advanced propulsion to new missions, showing how today’s innovations will shape humanity’s future among the stars.

episodes.name: The New Frontier  - Peering into the Abyss - Season 5 - Eps 09

info.plot: The New Frontier  - Peering into the Abyss - Season 5 - Eps 09 - Cutting-edge telescopes and technology take us to the edge of the universe, uncovering new cosmic mysteries and expanding our understanding of deep space in this thrilling episode of The New Frontier.

episodes.name: The New Frontier  - Webb of life - Season 5 - Eps 8

info.plot: The New Frontier  - Webb of life - Season 5 - Eps 8 - The James Webb Space Telescope reveals breathtaking new details about distant galaxies and the origins of life, transforming our understanding of the cosmos in this episode of The New Frontier.

episodes.name: The New Frontier  -  Oceans in the Sky - Season 5 - Eps 7

info.plot: The New Frontier  -  Oceans in the Sky - Season 5 - Eps 7 - Scientists uncover the presence of water in unexpected places throughout our solar system, revealing how “oceans in the sky” could reshape the search for life beyond Earth in this fascinating episode of The New Frontier.

episodes.name: The New Frontier  - Mountains in the dark - Season 5 - Eps 6

info.plot: The New Frontier  - Mountains in the dark - Season 5 - Eps 6 - Explorers uncover mysterious mountain ranges hidden in the dark regions of our solar system. Advanced technology and planetary science reveal new insights into these cosmic landscapes in this episode of The New Frontier.

episodes.name: The New Frontier  - Increasing Orbit - Season 5 - Eps 5

info.plot: The New Frontier  - Increasing Orbit - Season 5 - Eps 5 - Discover how satellites and spacecraft achieve and maintain higher orbits, enabling new missions and expanding our reach into space. Explore the technology and science behind increasing orbit in this episode of The New Frontier.

episodes.name: The New Frontier  - Earths Evil Twin - Season 5 - Eps 4

info.plot: The New Frontier  - Earths Evil Twin - Season 5 - Eps 4 - Once similar to Earth, Venus is now a hostile world. Explore how Venus became “Earth’s evil twin,” what its electric field reveals, and what this means for planetary evolution in this eye-opening episode of The New Frontier.

episodes.name: The New Frontier  - Rising Tides - Season 5 - Eps 3

info.plot: The New Frontier  - Rising Tides - Season 5 - Eps 3 - Rising sea levels threaten coastlines and reshape our planet. Explore how satellites and space technology track these changes and reveal the global impact of climate-driven tides in this episode of The New Frontier.

episodes.name: The New Frontier  -  Moon Shine - Season 5 - Eps 2

info.plot: The New Frontier  - Moon Shine - Season 5 - Eps 2 - Scientists use advanced lunar probes and telescopes to uncover the Moon’s hidden features, revealing new clues about its origins, resources, and the role it plays in Earth’s history and future exploration.

episodes.name: The New Frontier  - Star Light, Star Bright - Season 5 - Eps 1

info.plot: The New Frontier  - Star Light, Star Bright - Season 5 - Eps 1 - Scientists launch two advanced space probes to orbit closer to the Sun than ever before, unlocking new insights into how solar activity affects Earth and revealing mysteries that were once only theoretical.

name: Children of Dictators: Life Beyond the Throne

info.plot: What’s it like growing up in the shadow of power? This series dives into the lives of children born to some of history’s most notorious rulers.

episodes.name: Jaffar Amin: Son of Uganda’s Most Feared Ruler

info.plot: Jaffar Amin reflects on the legacy of his father, Idi Amin, and what it means to live with the name of one of Africa’s most feared dictators.

Emmy award-winning host Ashley Colburn delves into the wonders of Croatia, Slovenia, Latvia and Switzerland in her adventure-filled series, taking in the hot-spots and hidden gems.
On Wonders of Slovenia, a city settled during the Stone Age holds the countries oldest traditions, and liquid library. Ashley takes a journey through the Middle Ages, its castles and way of life.
The capital of Slovenia is one of the most picturesque cities in the world. A 45-minute drive north lies, Lake Bled. Ashley rows to the monastery to ring the bell and make a wish.
The soil of western Slovenia is so rocky that it is recognized as the karst region. Ashley explores the rich minerals of the salt fields, flies over the Adriatic and sails along coastline.
The capital city of Zagreb is bustling and is home to one million inhabitants. In nearby Kostanjica it’s chesnut season and she’ll collect them, roast them and enjoy them with the locals.
Every grape, tree, shell, and animal brings rich rewards, but the hands that prepare them are even more prized. Ashley is eager to learn the trades, walk where Romans walked.
Life moves at a different pace along this cultural center of Dalmatia. The most prized islands are off the coast of Split and Ashley finds the oldest grappa distillery on the island of Hvar.
Overcoming a turbulent past, this is where tourism and the Croatian language were written. Full of islands, coastal areas and mountaintops, this rich landscape was settled by the wealthy.
It’s time for donkey races, and some of the most prized National Parks in Croatia, which Ashley will explore by boat!
Undoubtedly this region’s architecture comprised of several periods is some of the finest in Europe. Yacht lover’s can’t resist and Ashley finds the hidden secrets in the surrounding area.
Continental Croatia’s abundance of land plays a key role for the country and Ashley experiences this while off roading through the plethora of vineyards and open space.
One of three Baltic states, Latvia’s rich forest holds the magic of Gauja National Park where Ashley rafts, canoes, treks, rides and bungees through the largest National Park in the country.
Ashley falls in love with the charm of Latvia’s capital city, Riga. The Soviet times left an abandoned history in Karosta and Ashley experiences the times as a prisoner.
From early morning cheese making to yodeling through the Alps, Ashley goes back to her Swiss roots in the mountains.  The sweetness and secret recipe to their most prestigious chocolate is revealed.

Ashley trains to climb the 6th most dangerous mountain in the world, the Matterhorn.  Celebrating the 150 anniversary of the first climb by Edward Whymper, find out if Ashley makes it to the pinnacle.
Explore by bus, train, railway and cogwheel the secret towns of Switzerland deep within in the Alps. Ashley explores the Swiss Travel System and explores the history of their transportation.
Go back in time and sift through layers of history as Jeremy Dehut and Barry Britnell search through history, geography, and archaeology for evidence of Israel’s first kings.

The Bible comes to life as Jeremy Dehut and Barry Britnell talk with archeologist, Scott Stripling about his excavation of the ancient city of Shiloh.  Go inside the expansive warehouse of the Israel Antiquities Authority and explore the crusader ruins of the Philistine city of Ashdod. Finally go high above the landscape on an aerial tour showing why the nation of Israel was continuously locked in conflict and war with their rivals by the sea.

Lost to time, Jeremy Dehut and Barry Britnell talk about the ancient city of Gilgal and the significance it played in Saul’s downfall.  Known around the world as one of the greatest battles of all time, you can visit the valley where David conquered a giant named Goliath despite overwhelming odds.  From the valley floor travel up a rocky pass via 4x4 Jeep to see the valley from a different vantage point and explore the ancient fortress of Quirbet Kieafa.

Explore a cave where David could have hidden from Saul while on the run for his life.  Surprises around every corner capture the truth, in a very short passage from the Bible, as Jeremy Dehut and Barry Britnell go deeper into the dark abyss and into their search of Israel’s United Kingdom. Visit the arid wilderness of Ein Gedi and see why David picked such a remote location to hide. Finally travel with the team as they venture deep into the West Bank to the city of Hebron, David’s first capital.

episodes.name: David, A Man After God’s Heart

info.plot: Go to the origin of Jerusalem and see exactly how the Bible describes that David’s men were able to capture the Jebusite stronghold and make it Israel’s capital city.  See artifacts of war and gain a perspective of the walls of Jerusalem that would have allowed David to peer down on Bathsheba, leading to a sin that will follow him for the rest of his life.  Finally go to the Gihon Spring and stand in the location where Solomon would have been anointed successor to David.

Jeremy and Barry visit the labs of the Temple Mount Sifting Project and talk with renowned archaeologist Dr. Gabriel Barkay about his work digging through rubble discarded from the temple mount during a political crime in the 1990’s.  See some of the discoveries his team has made that point to a temple and city during the time of Solomon. Explore the ancient community of Qumran as Jeremy and Barry talk about the written word and an amazing discovery which reinforces the validity of God word.

See the gospel through a different lens as two men explore the places where Jesus lived, taught, and died. Jeremy Dehut and Barry Britnell are your tour guides on this journey through the Bible lands.
Follow along as Jeremy and Barry visit Bethlehem, the birthplace of Jesus, and go to the Temple Mount in Jerusalem to see where the baby Jesus would have been dedicated.
Jeremy and Barry travel to Nazareth to see what life might have been like for Jesus growing up. Go inside a replica Jewish synagogue and see a carpenter practice his trade using 1st century tools.
Jeremy and Barry visit the wilderness of Judea and experience the unforgiving elements of the area Jesus would have been during His temptations.
Jeremy and Barry visit the city of Capernaum where Jesus lived during His ministry. Join them on a boat ride on the Sea of Galilee and see what fishing would have been like in the 1st century.
Jeremy & Barry visit Jerusalem and Caesarea Philippi to answer the all-important question "Who is Jesus?"
Follow along as Jeremy and Barry visit places surrounding the miracles of Jesus and go inside a 1st-century tomb believed to be the location where Jesus raised Lazarus from the dead.
Visit some of the places Jesus taught some of His most powerful lessons.  Visit the Cove of the Sower and the site where Jesus had a conversation with a Samaritan woman while resting by a well.
Step back into the 1st-century and experience a Passover meal similar to what Jesus would have eaten with His disciples on the night of His betrayal.
Visit the places where Jesus was put  on trial. Go inside the house of Caiaphas, the location where Peter denied his master.  Explore rarely seen ruins inside the excavation of Herod’s palace.
Visit the Church of the Holy Sepluchre and see the locations traditionally believed to be where Jesus was crucified, buried and rose from the grave. See where Jesus appeared after His resurrection.
Mankind is currently defying all 4 basic elements to engineer big, useful, ambitious, and environmentally friendly projects that will shape our future on Planet Earth and beyond.

Abu Dhabi is the biggest of the United Arab Emirates sitting in the heart of the oil rich Persian Gulf.  Oil represents more than two thirds of this city state\'s economy and with such easy access to all that black gold, the citizens of Abu Dhabi have become one of the most polluting on earth.  Cheap fuel means big cars, year round air conditioning and sweet water which comes from an energy intensive desalination process.
Before running out of oil, we better have a look under our feet, where lies a clean and inexhaustible source of energy: the heat of the Earth!

In downtown Guangzhou, China, one of the greenest structures on earth is rising.  Known as Pearl River Tower, the 71-storey building will rely on just wind and sunlight for its power supply.  This green skyscraper epitomizes the super tall corporate headquarter buildings of tomorrow as an iconic, high performance structure, that is designed in such harmony with its environment that it potentially produces as much energy as it consumes.

A huge global increase in energy consumption is inevitable.  Renewable energies alone will not satisfy our needs.  While nuclear energy is often associated with fission and its dangers, scientists across the world are trying to master its bright side.  Nuclear fusion is a safe, clean and unlimited source of energy.  But unfortunately, it is incredibly difficult to master.

name: Echo And The Elephants Of Amboseli

info.plot: Scientist Cynthia Moss and the Amboseli Trust for Elephants spent 2 months a year for several years following "Echo", the 60 yr old Kenyan elephant matriarch.

When the rains disappear, survival gets real. Watch Echo and her elephant family battle Kenya’s brutal dry season in Amboseli National Park. It’s a raw look at nature’s toughest test—where every water hole could mean life or death. Totally gripping wildlife drama you won’t want to miss.

episodes.name: Echo Elephants: Calves in Trouble Episode - Free

info.plot: Baby elephants in danger? Yeah, it’s as intense as it sounds. Watch Echo’s family scramble to protect their youngest when trouble strikes in Amboseli. These little ones face mega challenges—from predators to getting lost. It’s heart-pounding wildlife drama that’ll keep you totally hooked.

On the plains of Amboseli, the rains are over two months late. Echo brings the family to the palms to eat the last leaves. The wise matriarch resists the temptation to take them to inhabited areas where fresh crops are springing up and conflict waits. But young bulls on their own are running into trouble…

In the relentless drought, the youngest calves are starving. Hunger is driving elephants to forage on surrounding farms. Echo’s wise head keeps her family to the swamp. Rains arrive, but after five days, the much-needed downpours dwindle to sparse showers. Echo must bring the family through the long ordeal without loss, but it might be harder said than done.

The rains bring new life. Lush new grass is saving the 58 elephant families from hunger. An extraordinary annual reunion brings hundreds of elephants together in scenes of celebration, play and romance. Meanwhile, big bull Vronsky is on the hunt for a mate and ready to fight. He begins an epic battle with a rival, Gomer, starting by fighting for nine hours without a break.

In Amboseli, nine months of unrelenting drought have given way to longed-for rains. The elephants now have enough to eat. Echo is taking the family on a day out to the Snipe River. Isaiah’s spear wound needs urgent treatment. But the elephants are ruining new crops. A new idea could put an end to their destruction: it’s based on a simple piece of string.

After months of hunger, Echo’s family are enjoying good times. The matriarch and her family are dustbathing at the safe home where Echo shelters her young. Even when they run to defend themselves, they are only pretending to be attacked! This is the time when magnificent males such as Keyhole reappear. His arrival excites Echo\'s whole family. But around him, Amboseli’s finest bulls battle to breed.

In Amboseli, the harsh drought is tightening its grip. Echo and all the elephant families go to sleep and wake up hungry. Rain is falling, but in dangerous areas, drawing elephants into increasing conflict with farmers. Luckily Sinya, the calf that fell in the well is recovering at the orphanage in Nairobi.

It’s the baby boom. In Echo\'s family, her niece Elettra is a mother for the first time. She has a lot to learn. Three day-old baby Evaline finds the going tough, as her mother fails to watch over her, and the others send the adventurous youngster packing. Isaiah’s leg wound becomes re-infected, and he needs the vet again.

For Echo and her family, the weeks after the rains are good times. They have time to take a mudbath together. Baby Evaline is a handful, and new mother Elettra still hasn’t learnt to stay close to her. Echo’s unpopular granddaughter Edwina breaks away and gives birth, but lions teach Edwina how hard it is to bring up a calf without the protection of the family.

Norah and Soila race to Amboseli’s outlands to help rescue Qualida, an elephant matriarch trapped in mud. In her secret spot, Echo wakes to face a rebellion: half her family leave to eat at the palms. After four hours trekking through dry bushland, the incoming waves of thirsty elephants from the surrounding hills are nearing water. But trouble with the Maasai begins to boil over…
Discover the fascinating lands of Asia, where opulent images allow us to experience the unique beauty of nature and the stories of people and animals that live in a world that remains untouched.

episodes.name: Kaziranga National Park: India – Where Wild Things Roam

info.plot: The rare one-horned rhinoceros is being poached in Kaziranga National Park.  Herds of elephants are on the move and a new born baby elephant has lost its mother. Some people who live in Kaziranga are willing to risk their lives to make sure the wild animals stay safe. While others must guard their families against danger in the night.

episodes.name: Tun Sakaran Marine Park: Malaysia – Paradise Found

info.plot: One of the world\'s most diverse reef systems off the coast of Borneo has just become protected - Tun Sakaran Marine Park.  It\'s a magical paradise where an ancient volcano once erupted.  Hundreds of species of corals and fish live here and so do many people who rely on the sea to survive.  But in Tun Sakaran Marine Park precious marine creatures now come first and humans must find new ways to live.

episodes.name: Aso-Kuju and Unzen-Amakusa National Parks: Japan – Under the Volcano

info.plot: On the top of a smoking volcano, on the southern island of Kyushu in Japan, a Shinto priest performs rights that keep his community safe.  200 years ago his town was completely destroyed.  The last eruption here was in 1991.  Forty-three scientists, firemen and media workers died in the fire and ash.  A volcanologist who witnessed the death of his colleagues is concerned.  Yet another volcano on Kyoto now threatens to erupt.  But nature has created rare beauty here.

episodes.name: Mt Tianzhu and Mt Fanjing National Parks: China

info.plot: The man who saved the last colony of Guizhou golden monkeys is getting old.  He must pass responsibility on to the next in line.  But will his successor be able to keep the monkeys safe?  A Buddhist master has had the peace of her convent shattered.  She needs to replenish her spirit on the peak of a sacred mountain but she is afraid of heights!  Wild places still exist and peace can still be found in the world\'s most populous continent.

episodes.name: Gir National Park: India – Asia\'s Last Lion

info.plot: Gir National Park: India – Asia\'s Last Lion
Kinabatangan River: Borneo – Forgotten Paradise
Vietnam

episodes.name: Great Gobi National Park: Mongolia – Following the Wild Camels

info.plot: Great Gobi National Park: Mongolia – Following the Wild Camels

Explore the untouched beauty of Gaoligongshan Park, a hidden Himalayan treasure in China. From golden peaks to rare wildlife, this stunning documentary reveals one of the world’s richest natural wonders.
From the land of the rising sun to the pearl of the Pacific, series one of The Travel Bug takes you to unique, exciting and spectacular destinations that every traveller longs to see.

Often considered the jewel of the Pacific, Tahiti has some of the world’s most amazing beaches and aquatic life. But beyond the appeal of the warm ocean and colourful reefs are the contrasting influences of Polynesian Islanders and the French. The islands that make up this scenic getaway contain world-class resorts that provide an abundance of activities.

Papua New Guinea is a diverse and dramatic landscape, with unique culture, a colourful history, adventure and natural diversity unlike anywhere else on earth. The mostly untouched landscapes of this beautiful nation and the friendly people that inhabit it make it the perfect location for holiday-makers with adventure in their blood.

episodes.name: Japan, Part I (Journey across Honshu Island)

info.plot: Japan is a land of extremes, where sprawling cities and bright lights give way to snow-capped mountains and rice patties. The unique Japanese culture can only be described as quirky, and once you delve beneath the surface and escape to the little-explored parts of the country you come to learn that Japan really is the land of the rising fun!

Tokyo is one of the must visit cities of the world. It epitomises urban excess and is a sprawling metropolis that never shuts down. We explore some of the quirkiest parts of the city to explore the people, technology and culture that make this such a special place: from eating at a ninja themed restaurant to watching the robot Asimo at work.

The Philippines is a beautiful and exotic nation. The sprawling archipelago that forms this special part of the world contains countless islands, sandy beaches and smiling faces. The Philippines has unusual animals, weird foods and a colourful history, but best of all it is a destination where one day you can relax in a luxury resort, then the next you can get dirty in a street market.

Starting in one of the world’s great cities – Sydney we travel over the Harbour Bridge and dine with koalas, before heading into the Blue Mountains and out to the far west to the ancient landscape of Mungo National Park. This desert landscape is one of the most scenic and unique environments in the world and has a fascinating story.

Having explored the streets of Berlin and the nearby countryside, it’s time to hit the road west and make his way across the country. The first stop is Wolfsburg, a city built around the incredible Volkswagen factory. From there, it’s off to Cologne before following the compass south along the beautiful River Rhine.

We hop on board a luxury expedition cruise ship and heading into the wild and rugged Kimberley Coast of Western Australia. We explore everything from the ancient aboriginal rock art, to unique wildlife and wonders of Mother Nature. This expedition takes in all the highlights of the Kimberley and it’s all done in 5-star comfort!

This time, we start the journey in the green pastures of Northern Ireland. It may only be a small nation, but within its borders there’s a whole lot to see. It’s a dramatic country in more ways than one. It all starts in the big smoke of Belfast, before heading to Downpatrick to learn about St Pat, before moving north on the Causeway Coastal Route.

This episode starts at the most visited site in Northern Ireland, The Giant’s Causeway. It’s a dramatic coastal landmark that draws visitors from around the world. Then it’s off to the historic city of Londonderry, on the banks of the Foyle River. From there we head underground at the Subterranean National Park, before putting on an apron for a lesson in Irish cooking.

episodes.name: Taiwan, Part II (West Coast and Interior)

info.plot: The tropical north of Australia is a favourite for Aussies looking for a holiday where you can walk on secluded beaches, snorkel in warm, clear waters, relax in a resort or get stuck into a bit of adrenalin pumping adventure. From The Great Barrier Reef and rainforest of the Daintree, to Port Douglas and Cape Tribulation, this episode is one for the adventurous travellers!

It all starts with a train ride from Tokyo, taking him north into the mountainous interior. From there we head to the ski resorts of Zao and Appi, before heading south, finishing the first leg of the trip in the tsunami-devastated region of Sendai.

This episode sees us hop on a flight south, to the warm and sunny island paradise of Okinawa. It’s a part of Japan that a lot of western tourists don’t often visit. Despite only being a few hours flight from Tokyo, the islands of Okinawa seem like they’re a world away – It’s a hidden gem you’re sure to fall in love with!

episodes.name: Canada, Part I (Vancouver and the Rockies to Calgary)

info.plot: The United Arab Emirates is a place where ancient tradition crashes headlong into the modern world. At its heart is Dubai, an urban giant, with the Arabian Desert on one side and the Persian Gulf on the other. It’s a city of excess, with the world’s biggest building, the world’s biggest mall and numerous other manmade wonders that will blow your mind.

episodes.name: Canada, Part II (Niagara Falls, Ottawa, Toronto and Montreal)

info.plot: In this episode of The Travel Bug, we head to the heart of the United Kingdom! And where better to start our journey than in one of the world’s great cities, London. We take in all the clichéd sites and iconic locales, and most importantly, dig a little deeper to find some new experiences that tell the story of this amazing city.

This episode sees us leaving the crowded streets and hitting the road in search of a little bit of England’s history and to explore the rural parts of the country. Starting in Manchester, we visit the home of the world’s most popular football team and learn a little about the industrial revolution.

This season’s finale takes us back to some of the highlights of the series, as well as a couple of amazing places that we couldn\'t fit in. This includes a visit to the beautiful city of Frankfurt, and fishing for barramundi on a crocodile infested billabong in The Northern Territory. It’s a fun and adventurous episode that will leave you clamouring for more!

No trip to Scotland is complete without hearing some bagpipes, putting on a kilt and playing golf. From roaming the streets of Glasgow and mixing our own bottle of Scotch, to visiting the birthplace of golf and strolling in the shadows of the magnificent Edinburgh Castle, this episode is a journey that the history buffs will love!

episodes.name: Germany, Part I (Berlin and East Germany)

info.plot: It’s one of Europe’s biggest countries and a nation full of history and culture. Starting the adventure in the capital, Berlin, we head south to see where Berliners like to spend their holidays. From there we check out the industrial side of the country, ending the first half of our trip on the world’s biggest movable machine.

Having explored the streets of Berlin and the nearby countryside, it’s time to hit the road west and make his way across the country. The first stop is Wolfsburg, a city built around the incredible Volkswagen factory. From there, it’s off to Cologne before following the compass south along the beautiful River Rhine.

We hop on board a luxury expedition cruise ship and heading into the wild and rugged Kimberley Coast of Western Australia. We explore everything from the ancient aboriginal rock art, to unique wildlife and wonders of Mother Nature. This expedition takes in all the highlights of the Kimberley and it’s all done in 5-star comfort!

It’s a dramatic country in more ways than one. It all starts in the big smoke of Belfast, before heading to Downpatrick to learn about St Pat, before moving north on the Causeway Coastal Route.

With an exciting and upbeat style, the focus of this series is on bringing awareness of positive environmental and community-driven stories by taking the audience through Africa.

Episode 2 kicks off with a visit to the Zip Zap Circus School. When having fun and learning new, exciting skills brings children from all walks of life together in a positive learning environment.
In the first Episode of this weekly fast-paced, environmental magazine we visit a surf school to find out how catching waves can give troubled youths a new start and positive outlook on life.
